definition: to guess correctly/to figure out the right answer
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: On the world economy, too, we got the broad picture right.
sentences.chinese: 在世界经济方面，我们也猜中了个大概。

sentences.english: If the flip ends up in opponent's favor, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you.
sentences.chinese: 若对手猜中，则苏利南的瓶子对你造成5点伤害。

sentences.english: If visitors have right solutions to the riddles, they will get a little gift.
sentences.chinese: 如果赏花灯的人猜中谜底，就会得到小礼物。

sentences.english: The shepherd thought it unlikely the man would guess the exact number, so he agreed.
sentences.chinese: 牧羊人想他不可能猜中准确的数目，就同意了。

sentences.english: I nicked what he wanted to do.
sentences.chinese: 我刚好猜中了他要去做什么。

sentences.english: Our team won the toss so we play first.
sentences.chinese: 我队掷钱币猜中，所以先玩。

definition: (usually used in the negative) to answer or reply to sb's question
to hit the nail on the head/to predict correctly
to see through something at first glance (idiom)
see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to be unable to guess or make out
to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
to make a wild guess/blind guess
one word says it all (idiom)/to hit the nail on the head/to be pithy and correct
